title: German Research Foundation - Wikipedia
snippet: The German Research Foundation (German: Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft [ˈdɔʏtʃə ˈfɔʁʃʊŋsɡəˌmaɪnʃaft]; abbr. DFG [ˌdeːʔɛfˈɡeː]) is a German research funding organization, which functions as a self-governing institution for the promotion of science and research in the ...

title: DFG, German Research Foundation - A New Vice President for the DFG
snippet: The re-elected Vice President Karin Jacobs heads the Chair of Experimental Physics at Saarland University.

title: KIT - KIT - People - German Research Foundation (DFG)
snippet: The German Research Foundation (Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft, DFG) is the self-governing organisation for the funding and promotion of science and research in Germany. The DFG receives the large majority of its funds from the federal government and the states.

title: Germany, German Research Foundation (DFG) - International Science Council
snippet: The Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG, German Research Foundation) is the central self-governing research funding organisation in Germany. The DFG serves the sciences and humanities and promotes research of the highest quality in all its forms and disciplines at universities and non-university research institutions.
